cyclone.name: GRACE
cyclone.current_location: near Guadeloupe, about 15 miles north of Guadeloupe
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest through the Leeward Islands, passing near the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico on Sunday, then toward the Dominican Republic/Haiti
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern Dominican Republic coast (near Cabo Caucedo–Samaná)

weather_observation.watch_coast: South coast of the Dominican Republic from the Haiti border eastward to Cabo Caucedo and north coast from Haiti border westward to Samaná
weather_observation.warning_coast: Antigua and Barbuda, Anguilla, St. Kitts–Nevis–Montserrat, Saba & Sint Eustatius, Sint Maarten, St. Martin & St. Barthelemy, British Virgin Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico (incl. Vieques & Culebra), Dominican Republic Cabo Caucedo to Samaná
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Haiti
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Sunday, strongest around midday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for St. Croix; minimal coastal inundation
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls reducing visibility, possible power outages and minor debris affecting port operations
